questions.question: この道をまっすぐ行くと、左にコンビニが（　　　）。
questions.hint:
道みち (michi) – road
まっすぐ (massugu) – straight
見えますみえます (miemasu) – can be seen

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『見えます』 means 'can be seen' and fits naturally when describing something visible along the way.

  • 1. 見えます – can be seen (見えます, miemasu)
  • 2. 聞こえます – can be heard (聞こえます, kikoemasu)
  • 3. 作ります – to make (作ります, tsukurimasu)
  • 4. 入れます – to put in (入れます, iremasu)

English Translation: If you go straight along this road, you can see a convenience store on the left.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 1. 見えます (miemasu) – can be seen
The other choices do not fit the context of visually noticing a building ahead.

questions.question: 友だちにプレゼントを（　　　）、とてもよろこばれました。
questions.hint:
友だちともだち (tomodachi) – friend
喜ばれましたよろこばれました (yorokobaremashita) – was pleased

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『あげたら』 means 'if I gave'. It explains why the friend was happy.

  • 1. あげたら – if I gave (あげる, ageru)
  • 2. もらったら – if I received (もらう, morau)
  • 3. ならったら – if I learned (ならう, narau)
  • 4. おくれたら – if I was late (おくれる, okureru)

English Translation: When I gave my friend a gift, they were very happy.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 1. あげたら (ageru) – if I gave
Only this makes sense with someone else being pleased.

questions.question: パーティーの前に、部屋を（　　　）おきます。
questions.hint:
部屋へや (heya) – room
掃除そうじ (souji) – cleaning
おきます (okimasu) – to prepare in advance

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『そうじして』 means 'clean (the room)'. It makes sense before a party as preparation.

  • 1. そうじして – cleaning (掃除して, souji shite)
  • 2. ならべて – arranging (並べて, narabete)
  • 3. つけて – turning on (付けて, tsukete)
  • 4. たべて – eating (食べて, tabete)

English Translation: I will clean the room before the party.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 1. そうじして (souji shite) – cleaning
Other actions may occur before a party, but cleaning is the most essential and logical.

questions.question: 道にまよったときは、地図で（　　　）みましょう。
questions.hint:
道みち (michi) – road
地図ちず (chizu) – map
確かめてたしかめて (tashikamete) – to confirm

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『たしかめて』 means 'confirm/check'. Checking a map is a good action when lost.

  • 1. たしかめて – to confirm (確かめて, tashikamete)
  • 2. おどろいて – to be surprised (驚いて, odoroite)
  • 3. しんじて – to believe (信じて, shinjite)
  • 4. わすれて – to forget (忘れて, wasurete)

English Translation: If you're lost, let’s check the map.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 1. たしかめて (tashikamete) – to confirm
The other options don’t offer helpful actions in a lost situation.

questions.question: このパソコンは古いけど、まだ（　　　）。
questions.hint:
使えますつかえます (tsukaemasu) – can be used
古いふるい (furui) – old

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『使えます』 means 'can still be used'. It fits naturally with an old computer that still works.

  • 1. 使え – imperative form (使え, tsukae)
  • 2. 使って – te-form (使って, tsukatte)
  • 3. 使われて – passive form (使われて, tsukawarete)
  • 4. 使えます – can be used (使えます, tsukaemasu)

English Translation: This computer is old, but it still can be used.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 4. 使えます (tsukaemasu) – can be used
Other forms are grammatically incorrect or change the nuance completely.
